Citation.sAbstract: Liquid liquid equilibrium (LLE) data have been measured for one ternary system of water + N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone + 1-pentanol, and three  quaternary systems of water + N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone + 1-pentanol + sodium chloride, +potassium chloride, or +potassium acetate at temperatures  283.15 and 323.15K under atmospheric pressure. The liquid-phase splitting for ternary system of water + N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone + 1-pentanol  can be enhanced by adding the same percentage of salts (sodium chloride, potassium chloride, or potassium acetate) and the influence follows the  order of sodium chloride greater than potassium chloride greater than potassium acetate. The experimental data were also compared with the values calculated by the  Electrolyte-NRTL model. In general, the model reproduces reasonably for the LLE phase diagrams.
Citation.sTitle: Salting effect on the liquid liquid equilibria for the ternary system water +N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone + 1-pentanol
